main event: Two silently spherical objects connected by a dark unidentified body between them were observed, with one end larger than the other.
interesting points: The objects were first sighted descending slowly, then rose at a rate of 1500-2000 ft per minute until going out of sight into a layer of cirrus clouds.
The speed, size, and course of the objects were unknown, so the case was evaluated as insufficient data.
A second report describes a luminous object 10 feet in diameter with an orange-reddish color, hovering and moving in the sky, observed by one officer and two airmen.
The weather conditions for the second sighting were a dark, clear sky.
The second sighting was reported to the Air Technical Intelligence Center and Air Force Office of Intelligence, with a conclusion of unidentified.
sighted object: two silently spherical objects connected by a dark unidentified body, and a luminous 10-foot diameter orange-reddish object
